required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ACCELERATE Study - A Study of PEGASYS (Peginterferon Alfa-2a (40KD)) in Combination With COPEGUS (Ribavirin) in Interferon-Naive Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C (CHC) Infection.
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-label Study of the Effect of PEGASYS and Ribavirin Combination Therapy on Sustained Virologic Response in Interferon-naïve Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C Genotype 2 or 3 Infection

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of different durations of treatment with PEGASYS combined with ribavirin in patients with CHC genotype 2 or 3 infection who have never previously received interferon (IFN) therapy. The anticipated time on study treatment is 3-12 months and the target sample size is 500+ individuals.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virological Response (SVR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Week 40 (for 16-week treatment group); Week 48 (for 24-week treatment group)
primary_outcome.description: SVR was defined as the percentage of participants with undetectable HCV RNA at 24 weeks after the completion of the study treatment. The negative assessment was required to be the last one collected at or after week 36 (ie, on or after study Day 253) for the 16-week treatment group or at or after week 44 (ie, on or after study Day 309) for the 24-week treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Virological Response at The End of Study Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 16 (for 16-week treatment group); Week 24 (for 24-week treatment group)
secondary_outcome.description: Virological response was defined as the percentage of participants with undetectable HCV RNA at the completion of the study treatment. The negative assessment was required to be the last one collected in the Week 16 time window for the 16-week treatment group or in the Week 24 time window for the 24-week treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Virological Response 12 Weeks Post-Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 28 (for 16-week treatment group); Week 36 (for 24-week treatment group)
secondary_outcome.description: Virological response 12 weeks post-treatment was defined as the percentage of participants with undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after the completion of the study treatment . The negative assessment was required to be the last one collected in the week 28 time window for the 16- week treatment group or in the week 36 time window for the 24-week treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that occurred during he course of the trial after study treatment had started. An adverse event was therefore any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not considered related to the study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Marked Laboratory Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with changes in Hematocrit: Fraction 0.36 - 0.60 g/dL, Hemoglobin: 11.0 -20.0 g/dL, WBC 3.0 - 18.0 g/dL, Platelets 100 - 700 g/dL, Basophils 0.00 - 0.30 g/dL, Lymphocytes 1.00 - 6.30 g/dL, Monocytes 0.08 - 2.00 g/dL, Neutrophils 1.50 or more g/dL, Eosinophils 0.00 - 1.50 g/dL , PTT 0 - 50 seconds, Alkaline Phosphatase 0 - 190 and ASAT 0 - 50 U/L, ALAT 0 - 60 U/L, Gamma - GT 0 - 120 U/L, Total Protein 55 - 87 g/L ;Albumin 27.0 or more g/L, Total Bilirubin 0 - 34.2 μmol/L, BUN 0 - 14.3 mmol/L, Creatinine 0 - 154 μmol/L, Free T3, T4 5 - 40 pmol/L, TSH 0.0 - 10.0 mU/L, Cholesterol 0.0 - 8.3 mmol/L; Triglycerides 0.00 - 2.83 mmol/L, Chloride 95 - 115 mmol/L; Potassium 3.0 - 6.0 mmol/L; Sodium 130 - 150 mmol/L, miscellaneous: Calcium 2.00 - 2.90 mmol/L; Phosphate 0.75 - 1.60 mmol/L; Blood Glucose (Random) 2.80 - 11.10 mmol/L, Uric Acid 0 - 600 μmol/L, Proteinuria, Glycosuria, Hematuria (Qualitative 0 to 4+) 0 - 1 were analysed for the laboratory abnormality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With Marked Abnormal Vital Signs
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with changes in Systolic and diastolic blood pressure, heart rate were analysed abnormal vital signs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Highest Triglyceride Level
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with triglyceride level above normal (i.e. < 200 mg/dL) were analysed.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted in 8 countries from 20 November 2003 to 13 September 2005.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 1400 participants were planned for the study; 1469 were randomized (736 were assigned to the 16-week treatment group and 733 were assigned to the 24-week treatment group) and 1465 received the study treatment.

group.title: PEG-IFN Alfa-2a 180μg + Ribavirin 800 mg 16 Weeks
group.description: Participants received 180 micrograms (mcg) of PEG-IFN alfa-2a once weekly and 800 milligrams (mg) of ribavirin daily for 16 weeks.

group.title: PEG-IFN Alfa-2a 180μg + Ribavirin 800 mg 24 Weeks
group.description: Participants received 180 mcg of PEG-IFN alfa-2a once weekly and 800 mg of ribavirin daily for 24 weeks.

group.title: PEG-IFN Alfa-2a 180μg + Ribavirin 800 mg 16 Weeks
group.description: Participants were administered 180 micrograms (μg) of PEG-IFN alfa-2a once weekly and 800 milligrams (mg) of ribavirin daily for 16 weeks.

group.title: PEG-IFN Alfa-2a 180μg + Ribavirin 800 mg 24 Weeks
group.description: Participants were administered 180 μg of PEG-IFN alfa-2a once weekly and 800 mg of ribavirin daily for 24 weeks.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virological Response (SVR)
outcome.description: SVR was defined as the percentage of participants with undetectable HCV RNA at 24 weeks after the completion of the study treatment. The negative assessment was required to be the last one collected at or after week 36 (ie, on or after study Day 253) for the 16-week treatment group or at or after week 44 (ie, on or after study Day 309) for the 24-week treatment group.
outcome.time_frame: Week 40 (for 16-week treatment group); Week 48 (for 24-week treatment group)
outcome.population: Standard population: The standard population includes all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication and who did not have any of the major protocol violations or deviations.

group.title: PEG-IFN Alfa-2a 180μg + Ribavirin 800 mg 16 Weeks
group.description: Participants were administered 180 micrograms (μg) of PEG-IFN alfa-2a once weekly and 800 milligrams (mg) of ribavirin daily for 16 weeks.

group.title: PEG-IFN Alfa-2a 180μg + Ribavirin 800 mg 24 Weeks
group.description: Participants were administered 180 μg of PEG-IFN alfa-2a once weekly and 800 mg of ribavirin daily for 24 weeks.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virological Response (SVR)
measure.description: SVR was defined as the percentage of participants with undetectable HCV RNA at 24 weeks after the completion of the study treatment. The negative assessment was required to be the last one collected at or after week 36 (ie, on or after study Day 253) for the 16-week treatment group or at or after week 44 (ie, on or after study Day 309) for the 24-week treatment group.
measure.population: Standard population: The standard population includes all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication and who did not have any of the major protocol violations or deviations.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: These results indicated that sustained virological response achieved with 16 weeks of treatment was not equivalent to that achieved with 24 week of treatment.
analysis.method_desc: stratified by country and HCV genotype.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Virological Response at The End of Study Treatment
outcome.description: Virological response was defined as the percentage of participants with undetectable HCV RNA at the completion of the study treatment. The negative assessment was required to be the last one collected in the Week 16 time window for the 16-week treatment group or in the Week 24 time window for the 24-week treatment group.
outcome.time_frame: Week 16 (for 16-week treatment group); Week 24 (for 24-week treatment group)
outcome.population: Standard population: The standard population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication and who did not have any of the major protocol violations or deviations.

group.title: PEG-IFN Alfa-2a 180μg + Ribavirin 800 mg 16 Weeks
group.description: Participants were administered 180 micrograms (μg) of PEG-IFN alfa-2a once weekly and 800 milligrams (mg) of ribavirin daily for 16 weeks.

group.title: PEG-IFN Alfa-2a 180μg + Ribavirin 800 mg 24 Weeks
group.description: Participants were administered 180 μg of PEG-IFN alfa-2a once weekly and 800 mg of ribavirin daily for 24 weeks.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Virological Response at The End of Study Treatment
measure.description: Virological response was defined as the percentage of participants with undetectable HCV RNA at the completion of the study treatment. The negative assessment was required to be the last one collected in the Week 16 time window for the 16-week treatment group or in the Week 24 time window for the 24-week treatment group.
measure.population: Standard population: The standard population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication and who did not have any of the major protocol violations or deviations.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: In the analysis based on the standard population, end of treatment virological response was equivalent in the two treatment arms (94% in the 16-week arm and 92% in the 24-week arm).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Virological Response 12 Weeks Post-Treatment
outcome.description: Virological response 12 weeks post-treatment was defined as the percentage of participants with undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after the completion of the study treatment . The negative assessment was required to be the last one collected in the week 28 time window for the 16- week treatment group or in the week 36 time window for the 24-week treatment group.
outcome.time_frame: Week 28 (for 16-week treatment group); Week 36 (for 24-week treatment group)
outcome.population: Standard population: The standard population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication and who did not have any of the major protocol violations or deviations.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: These results indicated that sustained virological response achieved with 16 weeks of treatment was not equivalent to that achieved with 24 week of treatment.
analysis.method_desc: stratified by country and HCV genotype.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: An adverse event was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that occurred during he course of the trial after study treatment had started. An adverse event was therefore any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not considered related to the study drug.
outcome.population: Safety population: The safety population includes all randomized patients who received at least one dose of either study drug and had at least one post baseline safety assessment.

reported_events.desc: An adverse event was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that occurred during the course of the trial after study treatment had started. An adverse event was therefore any unfavourable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not considered related to the study drug.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
